verses.verse: On that day<WH3117> did the king<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325> give<WH5414> the house<WH1004> of Haman<WH2001> the Jews'<WH3064> enemy<WH6887> unto Esther<WH635> the queen<WH4436>. And Mordecai<WH4782> came<WH935> before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>; for Esther<WH635> had told<WH5046> what he was unto her.

And the king<WH4428> took off<WH5493> his ring<WH2885>, which he had taken<WH5674> from Haman<WH2001>, and gave<WH5414> it unto Mordecai<WH4782>. And Esther<WH635> set<WH7760> Mordecai<WH4782> over the house<WH1004> of Haman<WH2001>.

¶ And Esther<WH635> spake<WH1696> yet again<WH3254> before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>, and fell down<WH5307> at<WH6440> his feet<WH7272>, and besought<WH2603> him with tears<WH1058> to put away<WH5674> the mischief<WH7451> of Haman<WH2001> the Agagite<WH91>, and his device<WH4284> that he had devised<WH2803> against the Jews<WH3064>.
Then the king<WH4428> held out<WH3447> the golden<WH2091> sceptre<WH8275> toward Esther<WH635>. So Esther<WH635> arose<WH6965>, and stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>,

And said<WH559>, If it please<WH2896> the king<WH4428>, and if I have found<WH4672> favour<WH2580> in his sight<WH6440>, and the thing<WH1697> seem right<WH3787> before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>, and I be pleasing<WH2896> in his eyes<WH5869>, let it be written<WH3789> to reverse<WH7725> the letters<WH5612> devised<WH4284> by Haman<WH2001> the son<WH1121> of Hammedatha<WH4099> the Agagite<WH91>, which he wrote<WH3789> to destroy<WH6> the Jews<WH3064> which are in all the king's<WH4428> provinces<WH4082>:

For how<WH349> can I endure<WH3201> to see<WH7200> the evil<WH7451> that shall come<WH4672> unto my people<WH5971>? or how<WH349> can I endure<WH3201> to see<WH7200> the destruction<WH13> of my kindred<WH4138>?

¶ Then the king<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325> said<WH559> unto Esther<WH635> the queen<WH4436> and to Mordecai<WH4782> the Jew<WH3064>, Behold, I have given<WH5414> Esther<WH635> the house<WH1004> of Haman<WH2001>, and him they have hanged<WH8518> upon the gallows<WH6086>, because he laid<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> upon the Jews<WH3064>.

Write<WH3789> ye also for the Jews<WH3064>, as it liketh<WH2896> you<WH5869>, in the king's<WH4428> name<WH8034>, and seal<WH2856> it with the king's<WH4428> ring<WH2885>: for the writing<WH3791> which is written<WH3789> in the king's<WH4428> name<WH8034>, and sealed<WH2856> with the king's<WH4428> ring<WH2885>, may no man reverse<WH7725>.

Then were the king's<WH4428> scribes<WH5608> called<WH7121> at that time<WH6256> in the third<WH7992> month<WH2320>, that is, the month<WH2320> Sivan<WH5510>, on the three<WH7969> and twentieth<WH6242> day thereof; and it was written<WH3789> according to all that Mordecai<WH4782> commanded<WH6680> unto the Jews<WH3064>, and to the lieutenants<WH323>, and the deputies<WH6346> and rulers<WH8269> of the provinces<WH4082> which are from India<WH1912> unto Ethiopia<WH3568>, an hundred<WH3967> twenty<WH6242> and seven<WH7651> provinces<WH4082>, unto every province<WH4082> according to the writing<WH3791> thereof, and unto every people<WH5971> after their language<WH3956>, and to the Jews<WH3064> according to their writing<WH3791>, and according to their language<WH3956>.

And he wrote<WH3789> in the king<WH4428> Ahasuerus'<WH325> name<WH8034>, and sealed<WH2856> it with the king's<WH4428> ring<WH2885>, and sent<WH7971> letters<WH5612> by<WH3027> posts<WH7323> on horseback<WH5483>, and riders<WH7392> on mules<WH7409>, camels<WH327>, and young<WH1121> dromedaries<WH7424>:

Wherein the king<WH4428> granted<WH5414> the Jews<WH3064> which were in every city<WH5892> to gather themselves together<WH6950>, and to stand<WH5975> for their life<WH5315>, to destroy<WH8045>, to slay<WH2026>, and to cause to perish<WH6>, all the power<WH2428> of the people<WH5971> and province<WH4082> that would assault<WH6696> them, both little ones<WH2945> and women<WH802>, and to take the spoil<WH7998> of them for a prey<WH962>,

Upon one<WH259> day<WH3117> in all the provinces<WH4082> of king<WH4428> Ahasuerus<WH325>, namely, upon the thirteenth<WH7969><WH6240> day of the twelfth<WH8147><WH6240> month<WH2320>, which is the month<WH2320> Adar<WH143>.

The copy<WH6572> of the writing<WH3791> for a commandment<WH1881> to be given<WH5414> in every province<WH4082> was published<WH1540> unto all people<WH5971>, and that the Jews<WH3064> should be ready<WH6264><WH6259> against that day<WH3117> to avenge<WH5358> themselves on their enemies<WH341>.

So the posts<WH7323> that rode<WH7392> upon mules<WH7409> and camels<WH327> went out<WH3318>, being hastened<WH926> and pressed on<WH1765> by the king's<WH4428> commandment<WH1697>. And the decree<WH1881> was given<WH5414> at Shushan<WH7800> the palace<WH1002>.

¶ And Mordecai<WH4782> went out<WH3318> from the presence<WH6440> of the king<WH4428> in royal<WH4438> apparel<WH3830> of blue<WH8504> and white<WH2353>, and with a great<WH1419> crown<WH5850> of gold<WH2091>, and with a garment<WH8509> of fine linen<WH948> and purple<WH713>: and the city<WH5892> of Shushan<WH7800> rejoiced<WH6670> and was glad<WH8056>.
The Jews<WH3064> had light<WH219>, and gladness<WH8057>, and joy<WH8342>, and honour<WH3366>.

And in every province<WH4082>, and in every city<WH5892>, whithersoever<WH4725> the king's<WH4428> commandment<WH1697> and his decree<WH1881> came<WH5060>, the Jews<WH3064> had joy<WH8057> and gladness<WH8342>, a feast<WH4960> and a good<WH2896> day<WH3117>. And many<WH7227> of the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776> became Jews<WH3054>; for the fear<WH6343> of the Jews<WH3064> fell<WH5307> upon them.
